reviews.title: WOW - great place with great views
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for our 10th wedding anniversary and had a great time. Our apartment was large and everything you wanted was there. Modern too. The views are without a doubt, the best I;ve stayed in - ocean ocean and more ocean. The lovely hot spa was a real treat after shopping - soooo relaxing. Will definitely be back - maybe bring the children next time and stay in a 2 bedroom apartment.

We recently stayed 7 nights .The pool and grounds were beautiful but our apartment needed a makeover .We were told on arrival the dishwasher was not working and a repairman had been called .He didn't arrive and it was out of order for the week.(no one kept us informed)The main bedroom furniture was old and having to hold the curtains closed with pegs to keep out the light was annoying. It all also needed a good dust. When we booked we asked for an uninterupted ocean view but we were given a side front corner. Beautiful views... but. Also we have never heard of being charged an extra fee per night if we wanted airconditioning or DVD player.Reception service was ordinary. The balconies are long but if you have a bunch of friends holidaying together they are way too narrow for a gathering.It is nice & close to the restuarants & shops and the beach is just perfect.
reviews.title: Apartment needs a makeover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed 11 nights in the Boulevard Towers, while the view and the pool area was wonderful the particular apartment we had was shabby, tired and grubby. The carpet needed cleaning, tiled floors dirty, rolls of fluff and dust under the furniture. We would recommend that you ask to be shown your apartment before deciding whether to stay there. Ours was certainly in need to some TLC. The location is great so close to Broadbeach shops and eating out. The managers could have been more friendly, while being curteous a little more helpful at times would have been appreciated.
reviews.title: Great view, wonderful pool area, but shabby, tired & grubby apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was a nice place and reasonably priced, right on the waterfront, balcony etc but...... there were signs everywhere about the importance of recycling waste, when we found the bins in the basement (eventually) we found that all waste products were mixed up, we confronted a staff member there who's attitude was terrible, send your staff on a customer service course and recycle, dont accept excuses from your suppliers as to why this doesnt happen.... if you are not going to recycle then take down the signs around the place asking your guests to do so when there is no facility for them!
reviews.title: recycle recycle recycle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Boulevard Towers in April 2009, and we enjoyed our stay immensely. Boulevard Towers is right across from the surf beach with uninterrupted views of the surf beach. The building has recently been painted & upgraded and the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit we stayed in (Unit 32) had recently been renovated, and had glorious views over the surf beach. Magnificent.
reviews.title: A Perfect Location - Magnificent Sea Views

reviews.text: I travelled with my 3 teenage children during the first week of Sept school holidays. Unfortunately, weather put a downer on our holiday as we only saw the sun for 3 hours one morning! Boulevard Towers best features are it's excellent location to beach and short walk to shops and restaurants. Also the pool, spa and BBQ area was very clean and modern having recently been renovated. The view from our very roomy 3 bedroom oceanfront room was amazing thank goodness as we spent a lot of time in there. Now for the not so good. Service is pretty much non-existent. Very unfriendly and unhelpful staff. The place was pretty empty when we were there and we were told we couldn't have late checkout because they were full as it was school holidays. Unfortunately, our apartment was very dated and dirty with a many faulty appliances, unattractive furniture and fittings. The balcony was very narrow. Tiny, slow elevators that didn't fit our 4 cases. The indoor pool is the size of a spa and a dirty green colour. I feel the 3 bedroom apartment was extremely overpriced. Friends holidaying with us paid much less at the new Wave apartments which were beautiful and modern with lovely large balconys with outdoor chairs and tables, flat screen TV's, two pools and a gym. We definitely won't be staying here again and I wouldn't recommend it sorry.
reviews.title: Overpriced, dated with views

reviews.text: We booked a 2 bedroom on the 13th floor and the extra for higher floor, althought not that too much more was totally worth it.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.text: The whole apartment and it's decor were very comfortable and modern and had everything we needed. The location was so convenient to all amenities and we loved nothing more than getting back at the end of the day and soaking up the stunning views - this was certainly the highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: 13th Floor Bliss

reviews.text: The grounds, landscaping and pool bbq area were thoroughly enjoyed and we are already missing the warm evening dips in the very cool lit spa!
reviews.title: Excellent, view, staff, value, apartments, facilities, one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely recommend Boulevard to others and look forward to staying with you again.
reviews.title: A fantastic place for families or couples
